method: Season the pork shoulder with the cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Place the pork shoulder in a roasting pan and cover with foil.
Bake for 3 hours, or until the pork is tender and easily shredded.
Remove the pork from the pan and shred using two forks.
In a large oven-safe dish, layer the tortilla chips, shredded pork, salsa, and cheddar cheese.
Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve immediately and enjoy the pork-a-holic goodness!
